RN   [5]
RP   FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, ENZYME REGULATION, AND TISSUE
RP   SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=21949678; DOI=10.1371/journal.pone.0023157;
RA   Pan C.J., Chen S.Y., Jun H.S., Lin S.R., Mansfield B.C., Chou J.Y.;
RT   "SLC37A1 and SLC37A2 are phosphate-linked, glucose-6-phosphate
RT   antiporters.";
RL   PLoS ONE 6:E23157-E23157(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Inorganic phosphate and glucose-6-phosphate antiporter.
CC       May transport cytoplasmic glucose-6-phosphate into the lumen of
CC       the endoplasmic reticulum and translocate inorganic phosphate into
CC       the opposite direction. Independent of a lumenal glucose-6-
CC       phosphatase. May not play a role in homeostatic regulation of
CC       blood glucose levels. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21949678}.
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Inhibited by vanadate but not by chlorogenic
CC       acid. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21949678}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21949678}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=4;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q8TED4-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q8TED4-2; Sequence=VSP_028963;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q8TED4-3; Sequence=VSP_028961, VSP_028962;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=Q8TED4-4; Sequence=VSP_028960;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in intestine and pancreas. Lower
CC       expression is also detected in liver and kidney.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21949678}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the major facilitator superfamily.
CC       Organophosphate:Pi antiporter (OPA) (TC 2.A.1.4) family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAB84926.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally shortened.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Part of the ABC transporter complex UgpABCE involved in
CC       sn-glycerol-3-phosphate import. Probably responsible for the
CC       translocation of the substrate across the membrane (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins
CC       (UgpC), two transmembrane proteins (UgpA and UgpE) and a solute-
CC       binding protein (UgpB). {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane {ECO:0000305}; Multi-
CC       pass membrane protein {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the binding-protein-dependent transport
CC       system permease family. {ECO:0000305}.

RL   BMC Evol. Biol. 6:64-64(2006).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Plasma membrane broad-spectrum sugar-proton symporter.
CC       Mediates the uptake of linear polyols such as sorbitol, xylitol,
CC       erythritol or glycerol. Can transport the cyclic polyol myo-
CC       inositol and different hexoses, pentoses (including ribose),
CC       tetroses and sugar alcohols. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15525644,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15598803}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=0.5 mM for sorbitol {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15525644,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:15598803};
CC         KM=1.5 mM for glucose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15525644,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:15598803};
CC         KM=3.5 mM for myo-inositol {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15525644,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:15598803};
CC         KM=23.4 mM for glycerol {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15525644,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:15598803};
CC         Note=Determined at -60 mV (membrane potential) and an
CC         extracellular pH of 5.5.;
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum extracellular pH is 4.5 for sorbitol as substrate.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15525644, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15598803};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15525644,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15598803}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15525644, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15598803}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in roots. Expressed in
CC       vascular tissue of leaves, sepals and siliques.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15525644, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15598803}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By wounding and insect feeding.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15525644}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the major facilitator superfamily. Sugar
CC       transporter (TC 2.A.1.1) family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   POSSIBLE ROLE IN SLE.
RX   PubMed=18069935; DOI=10.1111/j.1399-0039.2007.00975.x;
RA   Tsai L.-J., Hsiao S.-H., Tsai L.-M., Lin C.-Y., Tsai J.-J.,
RA   Liou D.-M., Lan J.-L.;
RT   "The sodium-dependent glucose cotransporter SLC5A11 as an autoimmune
RT   modifier gene in SLE.";
RL   Tissue Antigens 71:114-126(2008).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in the sodium-dependent cotransport of myo-
CC       inositol (MI) with a Na(+):MI stoichiometry of 2:1. Exclusively
CC       responsible for apical MI transport and absorption in intestine.
CC       Also can transport D-chiro-inositol (DCI) but not L-fructose.
CC       Exhibits stereospecific cotransport of both D-glucose and D-
CC       xylose. May induce apoptosis through the TNF-alpha, PDCD1 pathway.
CC       May play a role in the regulation of MI concentration in serum,
CC       involving reabsorption in at least the proximal tubule of the
CC       kidney. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15172003}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O00505:KPNA3; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-10277669, EBI-358297;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q28728};
CC       Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q28728}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=6;
CC       Name=1 {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12039040};
CC         IsoId=Q8WWX8-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2 {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12039040};
CC         IsoId=Q8WWX8-2; Sequence=VSP_052790;
CC       Name=3 {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15489334};
CC         IsoId=Q8WWX8-3; Sequence=VSP_052789;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available. {ECO:0000305};
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=Q8WWX8-4; Sequence=VSP_033259;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=5;
CC         IsoId=Q8WWX8-5; Sequence=VSP_045034, VSP_052790;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=6;
CC         IsoId=Q8WWX8-6; Sequence=VSP_052789, VSP_045035, VSP_045036;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highest expression in heart, skeletal muscle,
CC       kidney, liver and placenta. Weaker expression in brain, colon,
CC       spleen, lung and peripheral blood leukocytes.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12039040}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Acts as an autoimmune modifier in systemic lupus
CC       erythematosus (SLE) as it is significantly associated with low
CC       complement component 4 (C4), anti-Smith antibody, serositis, and
CC       alopecia.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the sodium:solute symporter (SSF) (TC
CC       2.A.21) family. {ECO:0000255}.

CC       sn-glycerol-3-phosphate import. Probably responsible for the

CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA] OF 41-368, FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION,
RP   TISSUE SPECIFICITY, DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE, MUTAGENESIS OF GLY-285, AND
RP   DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RX   PubMed=15123614; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M402429200;
RA   Hoeflich J., Berninsone P., Goebel C., Gravato-Nobre M.J., Libby B.J.,
RA   Darby C., Politz S.M., Hodgkin J., Hirschberg C.B., Baumeister R.;
RT   "Loss of srf-3-encoded nucleotide sugar transporter activity in
RT   Caenorhabditis elegans alters surface antigenicity and prevents
RT   bacterial adherence.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 279:30440-30448(2004).
RN   [3]
RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=15452127; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M409557200;
RA   Cipollo J.F., Awad A.M., Costello C.E., Hirschberg C.B.;
RT   "srf-3, a mutant of Caenorhabditis elegans, resistant to bacterial
RT   infection and to biofilm binding, is deficient in glycoconjugates.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 279:52893-52903(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Acts as a transporter of both UDP-galactose and UDP-N-
CC       acetylglucosamine into the Golgi lumen.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123614, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15452127}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123614}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123614}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed exclusively in pharyngeal cells g1
CC       and g2, lateral seam cells, spermatheca and vas deferens.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123614}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: In seam cells, expression is first detected
CC       in late embryos, persists to the fourth larval stage and
CC       disappears in adults. In glandular cells g1 and g2, expression
CC       begins in the first larval stage and remains visible until
CC       adulthood. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123614}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Worms display altered surface antigenicity
CC       which prevents bacterial adherence. This is due to a deficiency in
CC       both O- and N-linked glycans. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123614}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nucleotide-sugar transporter family.
CC       SLC35A subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   GENE FAMILY.

RP   SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, FUNCTION, AND BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES.
RX   PubMed=27381418; DOI=10.1038/ncomms12119;
RA   Rautengarten C., Ebert B., Liu L., Stonebloom S., Smith-Moritz A.M.,
RA   Pauly M., Orellana A., Scheller H.V., Heazlewood J.L.;
RT   "The Arabidopsis Golgi-localized GDP-L-fucose transporter is required
RT   for plant development.";
RL   Nat. Commun. 7:12119-12119(2016).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in the import of GDP-mannose from the cytoplasm
CC       into the Golgi lumen (PubMed:11595802, PubMed:20576760,
CC       PubMed:27381418). Required for the luminal synthesis of a variety
CC       of plant cell surface components (PubMed:11595802). Is required
CC       for the correct mannosylation of the glycosylinositol
CC       phosphoceramides (GIPC). Can indifferently transport GDP-mannose,
CC       GDP-Glucose, GDP-Fucose or GDP-Galactose in vitro
CC       (PubMed:23695979, PubMed:27381418). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11595802,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20576760, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23695979,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:27381418}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=76 uM for UDP-Fucose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:27381418};
CC         KM=17 uM for UDP-Mannose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:27381418};
CC         Vmax=14 nmol/sec/mg enzyme toward UDP-Fucose
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:27381418};
CC         Vmax=24 nmol/sec/mg enzyme toward UDP-Mannose
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:27381418};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11595802, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27381418}; Multi-
CC       pass membrane protein {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q941R4-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q941R4-2; Sequence=VSP_026061, VSP_026062;
CC         Note=May be due to intron retention. No experimental
CC         confirmation available.;
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Dwarf phenotype, necrotic lesions and a
CC       constitutive hypersensitive response to salicylic acid induction.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23695979}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nucleotide-sugar transporter family.
CC       GDP-Mannose:GMP antiporter (GMA) (TC 2.A.7.13) subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Nucleotide-sugar transporter that transports UDP-glucose
CC       and UDP-galactose. Plays a role in lateral root and root hair
CC       development. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22933714}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22933714}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=1;
CC         Comment=A number of isoforms are produced. According to EST
CC         sequences.;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q94B65-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed with highest expression in
CC       roots. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22933714}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Early proliferation of lateral roots as well
CC       as distorted root hairs when cultivated at high sucrose
CC       concentrations. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22933714}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TPT transporter family. UGnT (TC
CC       2.A.7.15) subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in GDP-fucose import from the cytoplasm into
CC       the Golgi lumen.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q96A29-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q96A29-2; Sequence=VSP_047116;
CC   -!- DISEASE: Congenital disorder of glycosylation 2C (CDG2C)
CC       [MIM:266265]: A multisystem disorder caused by a defect in
CC       glycoprotein biosynthesis and characterized by under-glycosylated
CC       serum glycoproteins. Congenital disorders of glycosylation result
CC       in a wide variety of clinical features, such as defects in the
CC       nervous system development, psychomotor retardation, dysmorphic
CC       features, hypotonia, coagulation disorders, and immunodeficiency.
CC       The broad spectrum of features reflects the critical role of N-
CC       glycoproteins during embryonic development, differentiation, and
CC       maintenance of cell functions. The clinical features of CDG2C
CC       include mental retardation, short stature, facial stigmata, and
CC       recurrent bacterial peripheral infections with persistently
CC       elevated peripheral leukocytes. Biochemically, CDG2C is
CC       characterized by a lack of fucosylated glycoconjugates, including
CC       selectin ligands. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11326279,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11326280}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TPT transporter family. SLC35C
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

CC       Sequence=BAA92126.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May be involved in N-linked oligosaccharide assembly.
CC       May participate in the translocation of oligosaccharide from the
CC       cytoplasmic side to the lumenal side of the endoplasmic reticulum
CC       membrane. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18313027}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane {ECO:0000305}; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Congenital disorder of glycosylation 1N (CDG1N)
CC       [MIM:612015]: A form of congenital disorder of glycosylation, a
CC       multisystem disorder caused by a defect in glycoprotein
CC       biosynthesis and characterized by under-glycosylated serum
CC       glycoproteins. Congenital disorders of glycosylation result in a
CC       wide variety of clinical features, such as defects in the nervous
CC       system development, psychomotor retardation, dysmorphic features,
CC       hypotonia, coagulation disorders, and immunodeficiency. The broad
CC       spectrum of features reflects the critical role of N-glycoproteins
CC       during embryonic development, differentiation, and maintenance of
CC       cell functions. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18313027,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19701946}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the RFT1 family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [GENOMIC DNA].
RC   STRAIN=ATCC 23357 / A-11;
RX   PubMed=11473129; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M106504200;
RA   Thompson J., Robrish S.A., Immel S., Lichtenthaler F.W., Hall B.G.,
RA   Pikis A.;
RT   "Metabolism of sucrose and its five linkage-isomeric alpha-D-glucosyl-
RT   D-fructoses by Klebsiella pneumoniae. Participation and properties of
RT   sucrose-6-phosphate hydrolase and phospho-alpha-glucosidase.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 276:37415-37425(2001).
RN   [2]
RP   FUNCTION.
RC   STRAIN=ATCC 23357 / A-11;
RX   PubMed=11322729; DOI=10.1016/S0008-6215(01)00028-3;
RA   Thompson J., Robrish S.A., Pikis A., Brust A., Lichtenthaler F.W.;
RT   "Phosphorylation and metabolism of sucrose and its five linkage-
RT   isomeric alpha-D-glucosyl-D-fructoses by Klebsiella pneumoniae.";
RL   Carbohydr. Res. 331:149-161(2001).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The phosphoenolpyruvate-dependent sugar
CC       phosphotransferase system (sugar PTS), a major carbohydrate active
CC       -transport system, catalyzes the phosphorylation of incoming sugar
CC       substrates concomitantly with their translocation across the cell
CC       membrane. This system is involved in alpha-glucoside transport.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11322729}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in the transport and simultaneous
CC       phosphorylation at O-6 of the glucosyl moiety of sucrose and its
CC       five linkage-isomeric alpha-D-glucosyl-D-fructoses. Can also
CC       transport maltose, isomaltose and maltitol, phosphorylating at O-6
CC       of their non-reducing glucose portion.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11322729}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000305}; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIIC domain forms the PTS system translocation channel
CC       and contains the specific substrate-binding site.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIIB domain is phosphorylated by phospho-EIIA on a
CC       cysteinyl or histidyl residue, depending on the transported sugar.
CC       Then, it transfers the phosphoryl group to the sugar substrate
CC       concomitantly with the sugar uptake processed by the EIIC domain.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

RP   FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=21107422; DOI=10.1038/nature09606;
RA   Chen L.-Q., Hou B.-H., Lalonde S., Takanaga H., Hartung M.L.,
RA   Qu X.-Q., Guo W.-J., Kim J.-G., Underwood W., Chaudhuri B.,
RA   Chermak D., Antony G., White F.F., Somerville S.C., Mudgett M.B.,

RT   "Sugar transporters for intercellular exchange and nutrition of
RT   pathogens.";
RL   Nature 468:527-532(2010).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates sugar transport across membranes. May stimulate
CC       V(D)J recombination by the activation of RAG1.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21107422}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with TRPV2; the interaction probably occurs
CC       intracellularly and depends on TRPV2 N-glycosylation.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21107422}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21107422}. Cell membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21107422}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21107422}. Note=May also localize to the
CC       endoplasmic reticulum. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9BRV3-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9BRV3-2; Sequence=VSP_034916, VSP_034917;
CC         Note=Ref.1 (AAF17233) sequence differs from that shown due to
CC         frameshifts in positions 29 and 30. {ECO:0000305};
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q9BRV3-3; Sequence=VSP_034918;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Ubiquitously expressed with highest expression
CC       in oviduct, epididymis and intestine.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21107422}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SWEET sugar transporter family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

ID   PTSBC_PASMU             Reviewed;         474 AA.
AC   Q9CJZ2;

DT   27-APR-2001, sequence version 1.
DT   20-DEC-2017, entry version 109.
DE   RecName: Full=PTS system sucrose-specific EIIBC component;
DE   AltName: Full=EIIBC-Scr;
DE            Short=EII-Scr;
DE   Includes:
DE     RecName: Full=Sucrose-specific phosphotransferase enzyme IIB component;
DE              EC=2.7.1.-;
DE     AltName: Full=PTS system sucrose-specific EIIB component;
DE   Includes:
DE     RecName: Full=Sucrose permease IIC component;
DE     AltName: Full=PTS system sucrose-specific EIIC component;
GN   Name=scrA; Synonyms=ptsB; OrderedLocusNames=PM1846;
OS   Pasteurella multocida (strain Pm70).
OC   Bacteria; Proteobacteria; Gammaproteobacteria; Pasteurellales;
OC   Pasteurellaceae; Pasteurella.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=272843;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE GENOMIC DNA].
RC   STRAIN=Pm70;
RX   PubMed=11248100; DOI=10.1073/pnas.051634598;
RA   May B.J., Zhang Q., Li L.L., Paustian M.L., Whittam T.S., Kapur V.;
RT   "Complete genomic sequence of Pasteurella multocida Pm70.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 98:3460-3465(2001).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The phosphoenolpyruvate-dependent sugar
CC       phosphotransferase system (sugar PTS), a major carbohydrate active
CC       -transport system, catalyzes the phosphorylation of incoming sugar
CC       substrates concomitantly with their translocation across the cell
CC       membrane. This system is involved in sucrose transport.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00426}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00426}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIIB domain is phosphorylated by phospho-EIIA on a
CC       cysteinyl or histidyl residue, depending on the transported sugar.
CC       Then, it transfers the phosphoryl group to the sugar substrate
CC       concomitantly with the sugar uptake processed by the EIIC domain.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIIC domain forms the PTS system translocation channel
CC       and contains the specific substrate-binding site.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates sugar transport across membranes (By
CC       similarity). May regulate the expression of RAG1 a gene involved
CC       in V(D)J recombination. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8630032}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with TRPV2; the interaction probably occurs
CC       intracellularly and depends on TRPV2 N-glycosylation.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane {ECO:0000250};
CC       Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000250}. Cell membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000250}. Note=May
CC       also localize to the endoplasmic reticulum. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed at high levels in lung, placenta,
CC       spleen and thymus, at intermediate levels in brain, heart, kidney
CC       and testis, and at low levels in bone marrow, liver and lymph
CC       node. Within the thymus expression is highest in non-lymphoid
CC       cells. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8630032}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Up-regulated in mammary gland during lactation.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21107422}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SWEET sugar transporter family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

GN   Name=frcC {ECO:0000303|PubMed:11466273};
OS   Rhizobium meliloti (Ensifer meliloti) (Sinorhizobium meliloti).
OC   Bacteria; Proteobacteria; Alphaproteobacteria; Rhizobiales;

OX   NCBI_TaxID=382;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [GENOMIC DNA], FUNCTION, SUBUNIT, INDUCTION, AND
RP   DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RC   STRAIN=SU47 / Rm5000;
RX   PubMed=11466273; DOI=10.1128/JB.183.16.4709-4717.2001;
RA   Lambert A., Osteras M., Mandon K., Poggi M.C., Le Rudulier D.;
RT   "Fructose uptake in Sinorhizobium meliloti is mediated by a high-
RT   affinity ATP-binding cassette transport system.";
RL   J. Bacteriol. 183:4709-4717(2001).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Part of the high-affinity ABC transporter complex FrcBCA
CC       involved in fructose uptake. Is also a high-affinity transporter
CC       for ribose and mannose (PubMed:11466273). Responsible for the
CC       translocation of the substrate across the membrane (Probable).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11466273, ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins
CC       (FrcA), two transmembrane proteins (FrcC) and a solute-binding
CC       protein (FrcB). {ECO:0000305|PubMed:11466273}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane {ECO:0000305}; Multi-
CC       pass membrane protein {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Induced by fructose. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11466273}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Disruption mutant is unable to grow on
CC       fructose as sole carbon source, but can still grow with ribose and
CC       mannose as sole carbon source. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11466273}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the binding-protein-dependent transport
CC       system permease family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   TISSUE SPECIFICITY, HOMODIMERIZATION, AND INTERACTION WITH SUC2 AND
RP   SUC3.
RX   PubMed=12689351; DOI=10.1186/1471-2091-4-3;
RA   Schulze W.X., Reinders A., Ward J., Lalonde S., Frommer W.B.;
RT   "Interactions between co-expressed Arabidopsis sucrose transporters in
RT   the split-ubiquitin system.";
RL   BMC Biochem. 4:3-3(2003).
RN   [7]
RP   INDUCTION.
RX   PubMed=12529515; DOI=10.1104/pp.008037;
RA   Juergensen K., Scholz-Starke J., Sauer N., Hess P., van Bel A.J.E.,
RA   Grundler F.M.W.;
RT   "The companion cell-specific Arabidopsis disaccharide carrier AtSUC2
RT   is expressed in nematode-induced syncytia.";
RL   Plant Physiol. 131:61-69(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Responsible for the transport of sucrose into the cell,
CC       with the concomitant uptake of protons (symport system). Can also
CC       transport maltose at a lesser rate. May also transport biotin.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10948254}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=12 mM for sucrose (at pH 4 and 30 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10948254};
CC         KM=6 mM for sucrose (at pH 5.5 and 30 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10948254};
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 4-5. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10948254};
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Glycan biosynthesis; sucrose metabolism.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. Interacts with SUC2 and SUC3.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12689351}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000305}; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in sink tissues, mostly in minor
CC       veins of sink leaves. Localized in companion cells.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10948254, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12689351}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Also present in inflorescence axil branches
CC       and in anther and pistil of developing flowers. At anthesis,
CC       restricted to anthers. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10948254}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Specifically induced by H.schachtii (cyst nematodes) in
CC       nematode-induced syncytia. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12529515}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycoside-pentoside-hexuronide (GPH)
CC       cation symporter transporter (TC 2.A.2.4) family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAB60751.1; Type=Erroneous gene model prediction; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RP   REVIEW.
RX   PubMed=25988582; DOI=10.1016/j.pbi.2015.04.005;

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates both low-affinity uptake and efflux of sugar
CC       across the plasma membrane (By similarity). May play roles in
CC       nurturing the male gametophyte (PubMed:25988582).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8L9J7, ECO:0000303|PubMed:25988582}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms homooligomers and heterooligomers with SWEET6,
CC       SWEET8, SWEET9, SWEET11 and SWEET12.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24027245}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8L9J7}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8L9J7}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed in the vegetative cell during the
CC       later stages of pollen development, mostly in tricellular pollen
CC       grains, and, to a lower extent, in bicellular pollen grains.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16055690}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Slightly induced by the powdery mildew fungus
CC       G.cichoracearum and the pathogenic bacteria P.syringae pv. tomato.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21107422}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SWEET sugar transporter family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

ID   NEC1_PETHY              Reviewed;         265 AA.
AC   Q9FPN0;
DT   08-FEB-2011, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.
DT   01-MAR-2001, sequence version 1.
DT   15-FEB-2017, entry version 43.
DE   RecName: Full=Bidirectional sugar transporter NEC1;
DE   AltName: Full=NEC1;
GN   Name=NEC1;
OS   Petunia hybrida (Petunia).
OC   Eukaryota; Viridiplantae; Streptophyta; Embryophyta; Tracheophyta;
OC   Spermatophyta; Magnoliophyta; eudicotyledons; Gunneridae;
OC   Pentapetalae; asterids; lamiids; Solanales; Solanaceae; Petunioideae;
OC   Petunia.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=4102;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], FUNCTION, TISSUE SPECIFICITY, AND
RP   DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE.
RX   PubMed=11135107; DOI=10.1046/j.1365-313x.2000.00926.x;
RA   Ge Y.-X., Angenent G.C., Wittich P.E., Peters J., Franken J.,
RA   Busscher M., Zhang L.M., Dahlhaus E., Kater M.M., Wullems G.J.,
RA   Creemers-Molenaar T.;
RT   "NEC1, a novel gene, highly expressed in nectary tissue of Petunia
RT   hybrida.";
RL   Plant J. 24:725-734(2000).
RN   [2]
RP   FUNCTION, AND DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RC   STRAIN=cv. W115, and cv. W138;
RX   PubMed=11405624; DOI=10.1007/s004380100449;
RA   Ge Y.-X., Angenent G.C., Dahlhaus E., Franken J., Peters J.,
RA   Wullems G.J., Creemers-Molenaar J.;
RT   "Partial silencing of the NEC1 gene results in early opening of
RT   anthers in Petunia hybrida.";
RL   Mol. Genet. Genomics 265:414-423(2001).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates both low-affinity uptake and efflux of sugar
CC       across the plasma membrane. Promotes the formation of phloem
CC       bundles in mid-veins. Probably involved in the development of
CC       stomium cells that control anther opening time. Required for
CC       pollen viability (PubMed:11135107, PubMed:11405624).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8L9J7, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11135107,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11405624}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms homooligomers and/or heterooligomers.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8L9J7}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8L9J7}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8L9J7}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in nectary tissue and weakly
CC       in the stamen, especially in stomium cells and in the upper part
CC       of the filaments. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11135107}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Detected in the outer nectary parenchyma
CC       cells, the upper part of the filament and the anther stomium.
CC       Expressed in spots pattern on the surface of very young nectaries
CC       that do not secrete nectar and do accumulate starch. Highest
CC       levels in open flowers in which active secretion of nectar and
CC       starch hydrolysis have taken place. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11135107}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: 'Early open anther' phenotype; anther
CC       opening in young flower buds that contain immature pollen,
CC       resulting in poor pollen quality and impaired pollen release.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11405624}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SWEET sugar transporter family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   ABSCISIC ACID, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, TISSUE SPECIFICITY, AND
RP   DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE.
RC   STRAIN=cv. Columbia;
RX   PubMed=20963606; DOI=10.1007/s00425-010-1293-8;
RA   Seo P.J., Park J.-M., Kang S.K., Kim S.-G., Park C.-M.;
RT   "An Arabidopsis senescence-associated protein SAG29 regulates cell
RT   viability under high salinity.";
RL   Planta 233:189-200(2011).
RN   [8]
RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=22157085; DOI=10.1126/science.1213351;
RA   Chen L.-Q., Qu X.-Q., Hou B.-H., Sosso D., Osorio S., Fernie A.R.,
RA   Frommer W.B.;

RP   INTERACTION WITH SWEET1; SWEET6; SWEET8; SWEET11 AND SWEET17.
RX   PubMed=24027245; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1311244110;
RA   Xuan Y.H., Hu Y.B., Chen L.-Q., Sosso D., Ducat D.C., Hou B.-H.,
RA   Frommer W.B.;

RN   [10]
RP   REVIEW.
RC   STRAIN=cv. Columbia;
RX   PubMed=25988582; DOI=10.1016/j.pbi.2015.04.005;
RA   Eom J.-S., Chen L.-Q., Sosso D., Julius B.T., Lin I.W., Qu X.-Q.,
RA   Braun D.M., Frommer W.B.;
RT   "SWEETs, transporters for intracellular and intercellular sugar
RT   translocation.";
RL   Curr. Opin. Plant Biol. 25:53-62(2015).
RN   [11]
RP   FUNCTION, DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE, DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE, TISSUE
RP   SPECIFICITY, AND INDUCTION BY SENESCENCE.
RC   STRAIN=cv. Columbia;
RX   PubMed=25794936; DOI=10.1105/tpc.114.134585;
RA   Chen L.Q., Lin I.W., Qu X.Q., Sosso D., McFarlane H.E., Londono A.,
RA   Samuels A.L., Frommer W.B.;
RT   "A cascade of sequentially expressed sucrose transporters in the seed
RT   coat and endosperm provides nutrition for the Arabidopsis embryo.";
RL   Plant Cell 27:607-619(2015).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates both low-affinity uptake and efflux of sugar
CC       across the plasma membrane. Regulates cell viability under high
CC       salinity. Promotes senescence and sensitivity to salt stress
CC       (PubMed:20963606). Contributes to seed filling by triggering
CC       sucrose efflux involved in the transfer of sugars from seed coat
CC       to embryos (PubMed:25988582). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20963606,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22157085, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936,
CC       ECO:0000303|PubMed:25988582}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms heterooligomers with SWEET1, SWEET6, SWEET8,
CC       SWEET11 and SWEET17. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24027245}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20963606};
CC       Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20963606}. Golgi
CC       apparatus membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Accumulates in leaves during senescence, in a
CC       SA-independent manner. Expressed in the lateral roots and in
CC       flowers. Expressed in developing seeds (PubMed:25794936).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10412905, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20963606,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: In seedlings, expressed at low levels in the
CC       petioles (at protein level) (PubMed:25794936). In young plants,
CC       mainly expressed in the roots, particularly in the tips and
CC       primordia of lateral roots. In flowering plants, first observed at
CC       high levels in young buds of the inflorescence (at protein level),
CC       later detected in reproductive tissues, such as pollen grains and
CC       ovules. In developing seeds, accumulates specifically at different
CC       stages. At globular stage, mostly present in outer integument, but
CC       also in endosperm and embryo. At the heart stage, only observed in
CC       endosperm and embryo. From the linear mature cotyledon stage until
CC       mature seed, accumulates in outer integument and in micropylar
CC       endosperm. Detected at low levels in senescent leaves (at protein
CC       level) despite a high transcription induction during senescence
CC       (PubMed:25794936). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20963606,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Induced by the pathogenic bacteria P.syringae pv.
CC       tomato and the fungal pathogen B.cinerea, as well as by salicylic
CC       acid (SA) and abscisic acid (ABA). Induced by osmotic stresses
CC       (e.g. cold, high salinity, drought, mannitol, and sorbitol) via an
CC       abscisic acid-dependent pathway. Highly induced during senescence
CC       (PubMed:25794936). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10412905,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20963606, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21107422,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Reduced sensitivity to high salinity. In
CC       plants lacking SWEET11, SWEET12 and SWEET15, severe seed defects,
CC       which include retarded embryo development, reduced seed weight,
CC       and reduced starch and lipid content, causing a wrinkled seed
CC       phenotype. Altered sucrose efflux involved in the transfer of
CC       sugars from seed coat to embryos thus leading to starch
CC       accumulation in the seed coat but not in the embryo
CC       (PubMed:25794936). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20963606,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SWEET sugar transporter family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RP   FUNCTION, DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE, DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE,
RP   BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, AND TISSUE
RP   SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=28062750; DOI=10.1105/tpc.16.00465;
RA   Saez-Aguayo S., Rautengarten C., Temple H., Sanhueza D.,
RA   Ejsmentewicz T., Sandoval-Ibanez O., Donas D., Parra-Rojas J.P.,
RA   Ebert B., Lehner A., Mollet J.C., Dupree P., Scheller H.V.,
RA   Heazlewood J.L., Reyes F.C., Orellana A.;
RT   "UUAT1 is a Golgi-localized UDP-uronic acid transporter that modulates
RT   the polysaccharide composition of Arabidopsis seed mucilage.";
RL   Plant Cell 29:129-143(2017).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: UDP-glucuronic acid transporter that modulates the
CC       polysaccharide composition of seed mucilage. Transports UDP-
CC       glucuronic acid (UDP-GlcA) and UDP-galacturonic acid (UDP-GalA) in
CC       vitro. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:28062750}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=1.5 mM for UDP-GlcA {ECO:0000269|PubMed:28062750};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:28062750}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Ubiquitous. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:28062750}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed during seed development at the
CC       mucilage production stages. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:28062750}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Changes in cell wall monosaccharide
CC       composition with a strong reduction of galacturonic acid (GalA),
CC       rhamnose and xylose content in the sead coat mucilage composition.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:28062750}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TPT transporter family. TPT (TC
CC       2.A.7.9) subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   INTERACTION WITH AP2B1, AND MUTAGENESIS OF 12-LEU-LEU-13.

RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Testis;
RX   PubMed=21183079; DOI=10.1016/j.cell.2010.12.001;
RA   Huttlin E.L., Jedrychowski M.P., Elias J.E., Goswami T., Rad R.,
RA   Beausoleil S.A., Villen J., Haas W., Sowa M.E., Gygi S.P.;
RT   "A tissue-specific atlas of mouse protein phosphorylation and
RT   expression.";
RL   Cell 143:1174-1189(2010).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Insulin-regulated facilitative glucose transporter.
CC       Binds cytochalasin B in a glucose-inhibitable manner. Seems to be
CC       a dual-specific sugar transporter as it is inhibitable by
CC       fructose.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with AP2B1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16723738}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000250}; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasmic vesicle membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Principally intracellular. May move between intracellular
CC       vesicles and the plasma membrane. The dileucine internalization
CC       motif is critical for intracellular sequestration (By similarity).
CC       Insulin induces a change in the intracellular localization and
CC       gives rise to insertion in the plasma membrane. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highest level of expression in placenta and
CC       testis. Highly expressed in adult and pubertal testis, but not
CC       prepubertal testis. Lower levels of expression in brain, liver,
CC       heart, kidney, fat and skeletal muscle.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: High expression in blastocysts.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Inhibited under glucose deprivation.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the major facilitator superfamily. Sugar
CC       transporter (TC 2.A.1.1) family. Glucose transporter subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: The phosphoenolpyruvate-dependent sugar
CC       phosphotransferase system (sugar PTS), a major carbohydrate active
CC       transport system, catalyzes the phosphorylation of incoming sugar
CC       substrates concomitantly with their translocation across the cell
CC       membrane. The enzyme II CmtAB PTS system is involved in D-mannitol
CC       transport. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P28008}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: [Protein]-N(pi)-phospho-L-histidine + D-
CC       mannitol(Side 1) = [protein]-L-histidine + D-mannitol 1-
CC       phosphate(Side 2). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P00550,
CC       ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P28008}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P28008}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00427}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00427}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIIC type-2 domain forms the PTS system translocation
CC       channel and contains the specific substrate-binding site.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00427}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The PTS EIIB type-2 domain is phosphorylated by phospho-
CC       EIIA on a cysteinyl residue. Then, it transfers the phosphoryl
CC       group to the sugar substrate concomitantly with the sugar uptake
CC       processed by the PTS EIIC type-2 domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00422}.

CC       Sequence=AAN58875.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally shortened.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC       the membrane (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Part of the tripartite ATP-independent periplasmic
CC       (TRAP) transport system SiaPQM that catalyzes unidirectional
CC       Na(+)-dependent sialic acid uptake. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22167185,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22556361}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The complex comprises the extracytoplasmic solute
CC       receptor protein SiaP, and the two transmembrane proteins SiaQ and
CC       SiaM. SiaQ and SiaM form a tight 1:1 complex.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22167185}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22167185}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TRAP transporter small permease family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE GENOMIC DNA].
RC   STRAIN=ATCC 39315 / El Tor Inaba N16961;
RX   PubMed=10952301; DOI=10.1038/35020000;
RA   Heidelberg J.F., Eisen J.A., Nelson W.C., Clayton R.A., Gwinn M.L.,
RA   Dodson R.J., Haft D.H., Hickey E.K., Peterson J.D., Umayam L.A.,
RA   Gill S.R., Nelson K.E., Read T.D., Tettelin H., Richardson D.L.,
RA   Ermolaeva M.D., Vamathevan J.J., Bass S., Qin H., Dragoi I.,
RA   Sellers P., McDonald L.A., Utterback T.R., Fleischmann R.D.,
RA   Nierman W.C., White O., Salzberg S.L., Smith H.O., Colwell R.R.,
RA   Mekalanos J.J., Venter J.C., Fraser C.M.;
RT   "DNA sequence of both chromosomes of the cholera pathogen Vibrio
RT   cholerae.";
RL   Nature 406:477-483(2000).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The phosphoenolpyruvate-dependent sugar
CC       phosphotransferase system (sugar PTS), a major carbohydrate active
CC       transport system, catalyzes the phosphorylation of incoming sugar
CC       substrates concomitantly with their translocation across the cell
CC       membrane. This system is involved in N-acetylmuramic acid (MurNAc)
CC       transport, yielding cytoplasmic MurNAc-6-P. Is also able to take
CC       up anhydro-N-acetylmuramic acid (anhMurNAc), but cannot
CC       phosphorylate the carbon 6, probably because of the 1,6-anhydro
CC       ring. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P77272}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: [Protein]-N(pi)-phospho-L-histidine + N-
CC       acetylmuramate(Side 1) = [protein]-L-histidine + N-acetylmuramate
CC       6-phosphate(Side 2). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P77272}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00426}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00426}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIIB domain is phosphorylated by phospho-EIIA on a
CC       cysteinyl or histidyl residue, depending on the transported sugar.
CC       Then, it transfers the phosphoryl group to the sugar substrate
CC       concomitantly with the sugar uptake processed by the EIIC domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00421}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIIC domain forms the PTS system translocation channel
CC       and contains the specific substrate-binding site.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00426}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAF93383.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Sugar phosphate/phosphate translocator that transports
CC       inorganic phosphate, triose phosphate, 3-phosphoglycerate,
CC       xylulose 5-phosphate (Xul-5-P) and to a lesser extent ribulose 5-
CC       phosphate. Does not transport ribose 5-phosphate or hexose
CC       phosphates. Provides cytosolic Xul-5-P to the chloroplast, where
CC       it is used as an intermediate in the plastidic pentose phosphate
CC       pathways. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11842155}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Plastid, chloroplast membrane {ECO:0000305};
CC       Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11842155}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TPT transporter family. TPT (TC
CC       2.A.7.9) subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [9]
RP   REVIEW.
RC   STRAIN=cv. Columbia;
RX   PubMed=25988582; DOI=10.1016/j.pbi.2015.04.005;
RA   Eom J.-S., Chen L.-Q., Sosso D., Julius B.T., Lin I.W., Qu X.-Q.,
RA   Braun D.M., Frommer W.B.;
RT   "SWEETs, transporters for intracellular and intercellular sugar
RT   translocation.";
RL   Curr. Opin. Plant Biol. 25:53-62(2015).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates both low-affinity uptake and efflux of sugar
CC       across the vacuolar membrane. Regulates sugars homeostasis in
CC       leaves and roots by exporting/importing them through the tonoplast
CC       regarding metabolic demand (PubMed:24028846). Acts as a vacuolar
CC       hexose transporter, such as glucose (Glc), fructose (Fru), and
CC       sucrose (Suc) (PubMed:25988582, PubMed:24381066, PubMed:24028846).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24028846, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24381066,
CC       ECO:0000303|PubMed:25988582}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=9.9 mM for glucose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24028846};
CC         KM=15.7 mM for fructose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24028846};
CC         KM=10.8 mM for sucrose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24028846};
CC         Note=Vmax with glucose as substrate is 0.68 nmol/hour/Xenopus
CC         laevis oocyte. Vmax with fructose as substrate is 0.27
CC         nmol/hour/Xenopus laevis oocyte. Vmax with sucrose as substrate
CC         is 0.14 nmol/hour/Xenopus laevis oocyte.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24028846};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms homooligomers and heterooligomers with SWEET1,
CC       SWEET7, SWEET8, SWEET9 and SWEET17. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24027245}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Vacuole membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24028846, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24381066,
CC       ECO:0000303|PubMed:25988582}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8L9J7}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Mostly expressed in the cortex of mature
CC       roots, and, to a lower extent, in aerial organs such as leaves,
CC       stems, and flowers (PubMed:24381066). Mainly present in vascular
CC       parenchyma cells, especially in the petiole vasculature, flower
CC       stalks and at the base of individual, not fully developed flowers
CC       (PubMed:24028846). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24028846,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24381066}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Induced by nitrogen. Repressed by glucose (Glc),
CC       fructose (Fru), sucrose (Suc), cold, osmotic stress, and nitrogen
CC       starvation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24028846}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Increased root sensitivity to high levels of
CC       fructose. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24381066}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SWEET sugar transporter family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=20659277; DOI=10.1111/j.1365-313X.2010.04313.x;
RA   Andriotis V.M., Pike M.J., Bunnewell S., Hills M.J., Smith A.M.;

RN   [9]
RP   GENE FAMILY.
RX   PubMed=25053812; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1406073111;
RA   Rautengarten C., Ebert B., Moreno I., Temple H., Herter T., Link B.,
RA   Donas-Cofre D., Moreno A., Saez-Aguayo S., Blanco F., Mortimer J.C.,
RA   Schultink A., Reiter W.D., Dupree P., Pauly M., Heazlewood J.L.,
RA   Scheller H.V., Orellana A.;
RT   "The Golgi localized bifunctional UDP-rhamnose/UDP-galactose
RT   transporter family of Arabidopsis.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 111:11563-11568(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Glucose 6-phosphate (Glc6P) transporter. Transports also
CC       inorganic phosphate, 3-phosphoglycerate, triose phosphates and, to
CC       a leser extent, phosphoenolpyruvate. Responsible for the transport
CC       of Glc6P into plastids of heterotrophic tissues where it can be
CC       used as a carbon source for starch biosynthesis, as substrate for
CC       fatty acid biosynthesis or as substrate for NADPH generation via
CC       the oxidative pentose phosphate pathway (OPPP). Required for
CC       pollen maturation and embryo sac development.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15722468, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20659277}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Plastid, chloroplast membrane {ECO:0000305};
CC       Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in seeds, flowers, rosette leaves,
CC       and roots, with highest levels found in stamens. Found in the root
CC       cap, in guard cells and in mesophyll cells.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15722468}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed during the transient accumulation
CC       of starch in the developing seeds. Decline rapidly 8 days after
CC       flowering. Not detected in mature seeds.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12084821, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15722468}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Gametophytic lethal phenotype in homozygous
CC       plants. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15722468}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TPT transporter family. GPT (TC
CC       2.A.7.9) subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAB08759.1; Type=Erroneous gene model prediction; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RP   FUNCTION AS UDP-GLUCOSE TRANSPORTER, DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE, SUBCELLULAR
RP   LOCATION, TISSUE SPECIFICITY, INDUCTION, AND BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL
RP   PROPERTIES.
RC   STRAIN=cv. Columbia, cv. Landsberg erecta, and cv. No-0;
RX   PubMed=19906043; DOI=10.1111/j.1365-313X.2009.04066.x;
RA   Reyes F., Leon G., Donoso M., Brandizzi F., Weber A.P., Orellana A.;
RT   "The nucleotide sugar transporters AtUTr1 and AtUTr3 are required for
RT   the incorporation of UDP-glucose into the endoplasmic reticulum, are
RT   essential for pollen development and are needed for embryo sac
RT   progress in Arabidopsis thaliana.";
RL   Plant J. 61:423-435(2010).
RN   [9]
RP   GENE FAMILY.
RX   PubMed=25053812; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1406073111;
RA   Rautengarten C., Ebert B., Moreno I., Temple H., Herter T., Link B.,
RA   Donas-Cofre D., Moreno A., Saez-Aguayo S., Blanco F., Mortimer J.C.,
RA   Schultink A., Reiter W.D., Dupree P., Pauly M., Heazlewood J.L.,
RA   Scheller H.V., Orellana A.;
RT   "The Golgi localized bifunctional UDP-rhamnose/UDP-galactose
RT   transporter family of Arabidopsis.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 111:11563-11568(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Essential sugar transporter required for the transport
CC       of UDP-glucose from the cytoplasm into the Golgi and the
CC       endoplasmic reticulum. Essential for pollen development and
CC       involved in embryo sac progress. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10929106,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19906043}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=6.4 uM for UDP-glucose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19906043};
CC         Vmax=4.2 pmol/min/mg enzyme with UDP-glucose as substrate
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19906043};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19906043}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19906043}. Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19906043}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19906043}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Mostly expressed in flowers, and, to a lower
CC       extent, in roots, stems and leaves. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19906043}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Up-regulated by stimuli that trigger unfolded protein
CC       accumulation in the ER (UPR) (e.g. DTT or tunicamycin).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19906043}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The di-lysine motif confers endoplasmic reticulum
CC       localization for type I membrane proteins. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Lethal. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19906043}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Suppressor of the Yeast snf4 mutation that is
CC       impaired in sugar trophism.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nucleotide-sugar transporter family.
CC       UDP-galactose:UMP antiporter (TC 2.A.7.11) subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Insulin-regulated facilitative glucose transporter.
CC       Binds cytochalasin B in a glucose-inhibitable manner. Seems to be
CC       a dual-specific sugar transporter as it is inhibitable by fructose
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with AP2B1. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000250}; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasmic vesicle membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Principally intracellular. May move between intracellular
CC       vesicles and the plasma membrane. The dileucine internalization
CC       motif is critical for intracellular sequestration (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in testis, but not in
CC       testicular carcinoma. Lower amounts present in most other tissues.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: In testis, down-regulated by estrogen.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the major facilitator superfamily. Sugar
CC       transporter (TC 2.A.1.1) family. Glucose transporter subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: The phosphoenolpyruvate-dependent sugar
CC       phosphotransferase system (PTS), a major carbohydrate active
CC       transport system, catalyzes the phosphorylation of incoming sugar
CC       substrates concomitant with their translocation across the cell
CC       membrane. The enzyme II SorABCD PTS system is involved in L-
CC       sorbose transport. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10613875}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00431}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00431}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Induced by L-sorbose and repressed by D-glucose.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10613875}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIID domain, with its homologous EIIC domain, forms
CC       the PTS system translocation channel and contains part of its
CC       specific substrate-binding site. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00431}.

RA   Samuels A.L., Frommer W.B.;
RT   "A cascade of sequentially expressed sucrose transporters in the seed
RT   coat and endosperm provides nutrition for the Arabidopsis embryo.";
RL   Plant Cell 27:607-619(2015).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates both low-affinity uptake and efflux of sugar
CC       across the plasma membrane. Involved in phloem loading by
CC       mediating export from parenchyma cells feeding H(+)-coupled import
CC       into the sieve element/companion cell complex, thus contributing
CC       to the sucrose migration from sites of synthesis in the mesophyll
CC       to the phloem (PubMed:22157085, PubMed:24027245, PubMed:25988582).
CC       Contributes to seed filling by triggering sucrose efflux involved
CC       in the transfer of sugars from seed coat to embryos
CC       (PubMed:25988582). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22157085,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24027245, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936,
CC       ECO:0000303|PubMed:25988582}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms homooligomers and heterooligomers with SWEET1,
CC       SWEET3, SWEET5, SWEET6, SWEET7, SWEET8, SWEET9, SWEET12, SWEET13,
CC       SWEET15 and SWEET17. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24027245}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22157085,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24027245, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936}; Multi-
CC       pass membrane protein {ECO:0000250}. Note=Present in the plasma
CC       membrane of the phloem. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22157085}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in leaves, especially in phloem
CC       (PubMed:22157085). Expressed in developing seeds
CC       (PubMed:25794936). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22157085,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: In developing seeds, accumulates specifically
CC       at different stages. First observed at the linear mature cotyledon
CC       stage until mature seed, mostly in micropylar endosperm and the
CC       seed coat. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Slightly induced by the pathogenic bacteria P.syringae
CC       pv. tomato, the powdery mildew fungus G.cichoracearum, and the
CC       fungal pathogen B.cinerea. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21107422}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Under high-light conditions, plants lacking
CC       both SWEET11 and SWEET12 are defective in phloem loading and
CC       display slower growth, mild chlorosis, and high levels of starch
CC       and sugar accumulation in leaves (PubMed:22157085). In plants
CC       lacking SWEET11, SWEET12 and SWEET15, severe seed defects, which
CC       include retarded embryo development, reduced seed weight, and
CC       reduced starch and lipid content, causing a wrinkled seed
CC       phenotype. Altered sucrose efflux involved in the transfer of
CC       sugars from seed coat to embryos thus leading to starch
CC       accumulation in the seed coat but not in the embryo
CC       (PubMed:25794936). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22157085,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25794936}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SWEET sugar transporter family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

RX   PubMed=25053812; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1406073111;

RP   GENE FAMILY.
RX   PubMed=25804536; DOI=10.1105/tpc.114.133827;
RA   Ebert B., Rautengarten C., Guo X., Xiong G., Stonebloom S.,
RA   Smith-Moritz A.M., Herter T., Chan L.J., Adams P.D., Petzold C.J.,
RA   Pauly M., Willats W.G., Heazlewood J.L., Scheller H.V.;
RT   "Identification and characterization of a Golgi-localized UDP-xylose
RT   transporter family from Arabidopsis.";
RL   Plant Cell 27:1218-1227(2015).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Nucleotide-sugar transporter that transports UDP-
CC       rhamnose or UDP-galactose and UMP in a strict counter-exchange
CC       mode. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15456736, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25053812}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=87 uM for UDP-Rhamnose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25053812};
CC         KM=90 uM for UDP-Galactose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25053812};
CC         Vmax=56 nmol/sec/mg enzyme toward UDP-Rhamnose
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25053812};
CC         Vmax=28 nmol/sec/mg enzyme toward UDP-Galactose
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25053812};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16831428, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25053812}; Multi-
CC       pass membrane protein {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed in the whole plant.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25053812}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No visible phenotype. Slight reduction of
CC       galactose content in the cell wall composition.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25053812}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TPT transporter family. TPT (TC
CC       2.A.7.9) subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [5]
RP   FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, AND MUTAGENESIS OF SER-29.
RX   PubMed=22745127; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M112.379313;
RA   Geisler C., Kotu V., Sharrow M., Rendic D., Poltl G., Tiemeyer M.,
RA   Wilson I.B., Jarvis D.L.;
RT   "The Drosophila neurally altered carbohydrate mutant has a defective
RT   Golgi GDP-fucose transporter.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 287:29599-29609(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in GDP-fucose import from the cytoplasm into
CC       the Golgi lumen. Plays a major role in the fucosylation of N-
CC       glycans. Functions redundantly with Efr in the O-fucosylation of
CC       Notch, positively regulating Notch signaling.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19948734, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22745127}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19948734, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22745127}; Multi-
CC       pass membrane protein {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19948734,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22745127}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TPT transporter family. SLC35C
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [3] {ECO:0000312|EMBL:AAM29464.1}
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA].
RC   STRAIN=Berkeley {ECO:0000312|EMBL:AAM29464.1};
RC   TISSUE=Embryo {ECO:0000312|EMBL:AAM29464.1};
RX   PubMed=12537569; DOI=10.1186/gb-2002-3-12-research0080;
RA   Stapleton M., Carlson J.W., Brokstein P., Yu C., Champe M.,
RA   George R.A., Guarin H., Kronmiller B., Pacleb J.M., Park S., Wan K.H.,
RA   Rubin G.M., Celniker S.E.;

RN   [4] {ECO:0000305}
RP   FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE, AND DISRUPTION
RP   PHENOTYPE.
RX   PubMed=25901322; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1424514112;
RA   Yamamoto-Hino M., Muraoka M., Kondo S., Ueda R., Okano H., Goto S.;
RT   "Dynamic regulation of innate immune responses in Drosophila by Senju-
RT   mediated glycosylation.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 112:5809-5814(2015).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: UDP-galactose transporter involved in the synthesis of
CC       galactose-containing glycans. Plays a role in quiescence of the
CC       innate immune response, possibly by regulating glycosylation of
CC       the Toll pathway ligand spz. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25901322}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25901322}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Detected in lymph glands from late third-
CC       instar larvae (at protein level). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25901322}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Lethal in late larvae and early pupal
CC       stages. In immunologically unchallenged third-instar larvae,
CC       displays abnormalities of the immune organs, including melanotic
CC       cells in the hemocoel and melanotic tumors in the lymph glands; in
CC       the primary and secondary lobes, shows activation of lamellocytes
CC       and reduced numbers of hematocyte progenitor cells and
CC       plasmatocytes. In addition, displays hyperactivation of immune
CC       signal transduction via the Toll, JAK/STAT and JNK pathways; shows
CC       reduced expression of galactose-containing glycans affecting also
CC       spz glycosylation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25901322}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The gene name means "Buddha with a thousand hands
CC       manipulating tools to protect us" in Japanese.
CC       {ECO:0000303|PubMed:25901322}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nucleotide-sugar transporter family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAM29464.1; Type=Frameshift; Positions=340; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA].
RC   STRAIN=Berkeley; TISSUE=Head;
RA   Stapleton M., Carlson J.W., Chavez C., Frise E., George R.A.,
RA   Pacleb J.M., Park S., Wan K.H., Yu C., Rubin G.M., Celniker S.E.;

RN   [4]
RP   FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE, DISRUPTION
RP   PHENOTYPE, AND MOTIF.
RX   PubMed=19948734; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M109.016964;
RA   Ishikawa H.O., Ayukawa T., Nakayama M., Higashi S., Kamiyama S.,
RA   Nishihara S., Aoki K., Ishida N., Sanai Y., Matsuno K.;
RT   "Two pathways for importing GDP-fucose into the endoplasmic reticulum
RT   lumen function redundantly in the O-fucosylation of Notch in
RT   Drosophila.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 285:4122-4129(2010).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Sugar transporter that specifically mediates the
CC       transport of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine (UDP-GlcNAc), GDP-fucose and
CC       UDP-xylose. Functions redundantly with nac in the O-fucosylation
CC       of Notch, positively regulating Notch signaling. Involved in the
CC       biosynthesis of heparan sulfate-glycosaminoglycan (HS-GAG) and in
CC       Dpp signaling in the wing imaginal disk.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19948734}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19948734}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19948734}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed maternally and zygotically.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19948734}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Homozygous lethal. In a weak loss-of-
CC       function phenotype, a gap in the fifth longitudinal vein of the
CC       adult wing is observed. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19948734}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nucleotide-sugar transporter family.
CC       SLC35B subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RX   PubMed=19144319; DOI=10.1016/j.immuni.2008.11.006;
RA   Trost M., English L., Lemieux S., Courcelles M., Desjardins M.,

RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Spleen;
RX   PubMed=21183079; DOI=10.1016/j.cell.2010.12.001;
RA   Huttlin E.L., Jedrychowski M.P., Elias J.E., Goswami T., Rad R.,
RA   Beausoleil S.A., Villen J., Haas W., Sowa M.E., Gygi S.P.;
RT   "A tissue-specific atlas of mouse protein phosphorylation and
RT   expression.";
RL   Cell 143:1174-1189(2010).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Inorganic phosphate and glucose-6-phosphate antiporter.
CC       May transport cytoplasmic glucose-6-phosphate into the lumen of
CC       the endoplasmic reticulum and translocate inorganic phosphate into
CC       the opposite direction. Independent of a lumenal glucose-6-
CC       phosphatase. May not play a role in homeostatic regulation of
CC       blood glucose levels. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8TED4}.
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Inhibited by vanadate but not by chlorogenic
CC       acid. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8TED4}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8TED4}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9WU81-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9WU81-2; Sequence=VSP_028964;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in bone marrow derived
CC       macrophages, and weakly in spleen. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11004510}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Up-regulated by cAMP in macrophages.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11004510}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the major facilitator superfamily.
CC       Organophosphate:Pi antiporter (OPA) (TC 2.A.1.4) family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RP   INVOLVEMENT IN AMRS.
RX   PubMed=24031089; DOI=10.1136/jmedgenet-2013-101753;
RA   Edvardson S., Ashikov A., Jalas C., Sturiale L., Shaag A., Fedick A.,
RA   Treff N.R., Garozzo D., Gerardy-Schahn R., Elpeleg O.;
RT   "Mutations in SLC35A3 cause autism spectrum disorder, epilepsy and
RT   arthrogryposis.";
RL   J. Med. Genet. 50:733-739(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Uridine diphosphate-N-acetylglucosamine (UDP-GlcNAc)
CC       transporter in the Golgi apparatus. May supply UDP-GlcNAc as
CC       substrate for Golgi-resident glycosyltransferases that generate
CC       branching of diantennary oligosaccharides.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10393322}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with SLC35A2. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23089177}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P78381-1:SLC35A2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-3917581, EBI-8101118;
CC       P78381-2:SLC35A2; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-3917581, EBI-8101093;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10393322}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10393322}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9Y2D2-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9Y2D2-2; Sequence=VSP_012786;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q9Y2D2-3; Sequence=VSP_054232, VSP_054233;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- DISEASE: Arthrogryposis, mental retardation, and seizures (AMRS)
CC       [MIM:615553]: A disease characterized by arthrogryposis, mental
CC       retardation, autism spectrum disorder, and epilepsy. Additional
CC       features include limb malformations, distal joint involvement,
CC       microcephaly, retromicrognathia, and general muscle hypotonia.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24031089}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry. In Golgi
CC       vesicles isolated from patient fibroblasts the transport of the
CC       respective nucleotide sugar is significantly reduced causing a
CC       massive decrease in the content of cell surface expressed highly
CC       branched N-glycans and a concomitant sharp increase of lower
CC       branched glycoforms.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nucleotide-sugar transporter family.
CC       SLC35A subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in adult heart, brain, muscle and

CC       fetal brain, kidney and lung. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10729226}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Intellectual developmental disorder with neuropsychiatric
CC       features (IDDNPF) [MIM:617532]: An autosomal recessive disorder
CC       characterized by moderate to severe intellectual disability,
CC       epilepsy, and variable neuropsychiatric features, such as anxiety,
CC       obsessive-compulsive behavior, and autistic features. Mild facial
CC       dysmorphism may also be present. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:28434495}.

CC       represented in this entry.

RT   vegetative tissues of Arabidopsis thaliana mutants impaired in starch
RT   biosynthesis.";
RL   Plant Biol. 12:115-128(2010).
RN   [11]
RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT ALA-83, CLEAVAGE OF TRANSIT
RP   PEPTIDE [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AFTER LYS-82, AND IDENTIFICATION BY

RT   reveals similar and idiosyncratic N-alpha acetylation features.";

RN   [12]
RP   GENE FAMILY.
RX   PubMed=25053812; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1406073111;
RA   Rautengarten C., Ebert B., Moreno I., Temple H., Herter T., Link B.,
RA   Donas-Cofre D., Moreno A., Saez-Aguayo S., Blanco F., Mortimer J.C.,
RA   Schultink A., Reiter W.D., Dupree P., Pauly M., Heazlewood J.L.,
RA   Scheller H.V., Orellana A.;
RT   "The Golgi localized bifunctional UDP-rhamnose/UDP-galactose
RT   transporter family of Arabidopsis.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 111:11563-11568(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Triose phosphate/phosphate translocator that transports
CC       inorganic phosphate, 3-phosphoglycerate (3-PGA) and triose
CC       phosphate. Functions in the export of photoassimilates from
CC       chloroplasts during the day. In the light, triose phosphates are
CC       exported from the chloroplast stroma in counter exchange with
CC       inorganic phosphate (Pi), generated during sucrose biosynthesis in
CC       the cytosol. Involved in photosynthetic acclimation, a light
CC       response resulting in increased tolerance to high-intensity light.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12472685, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12586872,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20712627}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Plastid, chloroplast membrane {ECO:0000305};
CC       Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=1;
CC         Comment=A number of isoforms are produced. According to EST
CC         sequences.;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9ZSR7-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in shoots, leaves and flowers.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11842155, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21175634}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Expressed with a circadian rhythm showing an increase
CC       during the day and a decrease at night under long day conditions.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21175634}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No visible phenotype under normal growth
CC       condition, but strong reduction of triose phosphate export from
CC       the chloroplast and reduced photosynthetic acclimation.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12472685, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12586872}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TPT transporter family. TPT (TC
CC       2.A.7.9) subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAL10481.1; Type=Frameshift; Positions=164; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=BAB08256.1; Type=Erroneous gene model prediction; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RP   REVIEW.
RC   STRAIN=cv. Columbia;
RX   PubMed=25988582; DOI=10.1016/j.pbi.2015.04.005;
RA   Eom J.-S., Chen L.-Q., Sosso D., Julius B.T., Lin I.W., Qu X.-Q.,
RA   Braun D.M., Frommer W.B.;
RT   "SWEETs, transporters for intracellular and intercellular sugar
RT   translocation.";
RL   Curr. Opin. Plant Biol. 25:53-62(2015).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates both low-affinity uptake and efflux of sugar
CC       across the plasma membrane (By similarity). Nectary-specific sugar
CC       transporter required for nectar production by mediating the
CC       secretion of sucrose from the nectary parenchyma to the
CC       extracellular space. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8L9J7,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24670640, ECO:0000303|PubMed:25988582}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms heterooligomers with SWEET1, SWEET5, SWEET8,
CC       SWEET11, SWEET13, SWEET16 and SWEET17.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24027245}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24670640};
CC       Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24670640}.
CC       Cytoplasmic vesicle membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24670640}. Golgi
CC       apparatus, trans-Golgi network membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24670640}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Specifically expressed in nectaries, mostly in
CC       the lower half of nectary parenchyma.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24670640}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Accumulates progressively in floral nectaries
CC       during maturation, reaching highest levels during maximal nectar
CC       secretion. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24670640}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: In sweet9-1, reduced nectar production
CC       accompanied by starch accumulation in nectaries.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24670640}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SWEET sugar transporter family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
